defines.rdfs:label: Each instance of spacecraft is a transportation device either deployed entirely in outer space, or one whose trajectories leave the atmosphere of the planet it's launched from, in order to orbit the planet or to travel beyond the planet's gravitational field.
an artificial satellite
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing an artificial satellite

defines.rdfs:label: a rocket or any transportation vehicle that can reach orbit
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing a rocket or any transportation vehicle that can reach orbit

defines.rdfs:label: device typically used in instances of gathering information.
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing a information gathering device

defines.rdfs:label: an artificial satellite
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing an artificial satellite

defines.rdfs:label: an satellite collecting data on the weather of the heavenly body which it orbits
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing a weather satellite

defines.rdfs:label: an artificial satellite
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing an artificial satellite

defines.rdfs:label: These are unmanned vehicles which are sent to other bodies in the Solar system for the purpose gathering data. Sometimes a separate vehicle (probe or lander) is launched from the main vehicle, the smaller vehicle usually being referred to as a probe. In these cases, both vehicle would be SpaceProbes in the present sense.
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing a space faring probe

defines.rdfs:label: The set of the systems and supporting subsystems needed to fly a spacecraft, including structure and platform.
defines.rdfs:comment: a document representing a spacecraft bus

defines.rdfs:label: a Command and Data Handling Device
defines.rdfs:comment: The subsystem that ensures networking capabilities to other devices in the spacecraft.

defines.rdfs:label: a Propulsion Device
defines.rdfs:comment: The subsystem that ensures the propulsion of the spacecraft.
